p: We treated PRRSV with different concentrations of Thai medicinal plant extracts that were determined based on their CC 50 values so that these plant extracts did not affect the proliferative activity of MARC-145 cells. The screening results of the inhibition of PRRSV infectivity showed the potential of Thai medicinal plant extracts to inhibit PRRSV infectivity (Fig. 2). T. triandra extract significantly inhibited PRRSV infectivity in MARC-145 cells at 24 hpi when supplied at a concentration of 1250 μg/ml ( P < 0.05), and the observed virus titer at this concentration was 3.5 TCID 50/ml (log 10). Interestingly, P. emblica extract at a low concentration of 78 μg/ml could inhibit PRRSV infectivity [virus titer = 4.5 TCID 50/ml (log 10)]. As shown in Fig. 3, immunoperoxidase monolayer assay (IPMA) indicated that T. triandra and P. emblica extracts blocked PRRSV infectivity in MARC-145 cells, as shown by slight brown staining of cells.
